pull.title: doc: Add to Doxygen documentation guidelines
pull.body: Add some tips to developer-notes.md, gathered while doing #16947. Also suggests the simpler `:` notation for Javadoc arguments and adds `@return` and `@param[out]` example.

events.message: doc: Add to Doxygen documentation guidelines

events.body: Closing "Up for Grabs". There's a couple of improvements here that could be picked up.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -189,9 +191,18 @@ Not OK (used plenty in the current source, but not picked up):
 A full list of comment syntaxes picked up by Doxygen can be found at http://www.doxygen.nl/manual/docblocks.html,
 but the above styles are favored.
 
+Other recommendations:
+
+- Avoid redundant type and in/out information in function descriptions
comments.body: Can you give an example for all of these? (like the cases above)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -189,9 +191,18 @@ Not OK (used plenty in the current source, but not picked up):
 A full list of comment syntaxes picked up by Doxygen can be found at http://www.doxygen.nl/manual/docblocks.html,
 but the above styles are favored.
 
+Other recommendations:
+
+- Avoid redundant type and in/out information in function descriptions
+- Use backticks (``) to refer to `argument`s in function descriptions

@@ -189,9 +191,18 @@ Not OK (used plenty in the current source, but not picked up):
 A full list of comment syntaxes picked up by Doxygen can be found at http://www.doxygen.nl/manual/docblocks.html,
 but the above styles are favored.
 
+Other recommendations:
+
+- Avoid redundant type and in/out information in function descriptions
+- Use backticks (``) to refer to `argument`s in function descriptions
+- Backticks aren't required when referring to a Function() that Doxygen already knows about; it will build a hyperlink automatically
+- Avoid linking to external documentation; links can break
+- `STRIP_CODE_COMMENTS = YES` in Doxyfile.in, so if you want a standalone comment to be preserved in the Doxygen-generated source code, it must either not conform to Javadoc or be qualified (e.g. begin with `\file`, etc).
comments.body: End all or none of these item sentences with a period/full stop, e.g. "."; in this document the other item lists use periods/full stops.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -189,9 +191,18 @@ Not OK (used plenty in the current source, but not picked up):
 A full list of comment syntaxes picked up by Doxygen can be found at http://www.doxygen.nl/manual/docblocks.html,
 but the above styles are favored.
 
+Other recommendations:
+
+- Avoid redundant type and in/out information in function descriptions
+- Use backticks (``) to refer to `argument`s in function descriptions
+- Backticks aren't required when referring to a Function() that Doxygen already knows about; it will build a hyperlink automatically
+- Avoid linking to external documentation; links can break
+- `STRIP_CODE_COMMENTS = YES` in Doxyfile.in, so if you want a standalone comment to be preserved in the Doxygen-generated source code, it must either not conform to Javadoc or be qualified (e.g. begin with `\file`, etc).
comments.body: Wrapping lines at 80 or 120 characters for these changes could be nice for source code readability on smaller screens.
